page.title: 11My Dad's a Postman.
page.content: My Dad work for the Post Office in Wallingford. He starts work at 4.10 in the morning. First he sorts the letter which have arrived in a van from Oxford. This sorts the mail into 24 different rounds. He next takes the letters for his round from the sorting frame and puts them into the order of the houses on his round. He then delivers the mail by walking, cycling or by van. The number of houses on each round varies between 300 or 600 depending on whether it is a town or rural route. The number of letters can vary too, from 250 to 1000. After the first delivery he goes back to the sorting office ready for the second delivery. Sometimes he finishes at 10.30 and at other times it can be 2.00pm and he does this for 6 days each week. (John Sainsbury)
